diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient exhibited purpura, urticaria, angioedema, scleritis, and arthritis. A skin biopsy revealed leukocytoclastic vasculitis. The hypocomplementemia and ocular inflammation aligned better with hypocomplementemic urticarial vasculitis rather than Henoch–Schönlein purpura or rheumatoid vasculitis. The absence of classic bone erosions, lack of anti-CCP antibodies, and the nature of the patient's symptoms further supported this diagnosis.
